CALENDARIA.Calendar.Athasian.Description: The Calendar of Tyr (Merchant's Calendar) from the Dark Sun campaign setting. 375 days with a 6-day week and dual-cycle era naming.
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Athasian.Name: Athasian (Tyr)
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Barovian.Description: The calendar used in Barovia and the Domains of Dread (Ravenloft)
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Barovian.Name: Barovian
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Cerilian.Description: The calendar of Cerilia from the Birthright campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Cerilian.Name: Cerilian
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Drakkenheim.Descript: The calendar used in the Drakkenheim campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Drakkenheim.Name: Drakkenheim
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Exandrian.Descriptio: The calendar of Exandria from Critical Role's campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Exandrian.Name: Exandrian
CALENDARIA.Calendar.ForbiddenLands.Descr: The calendar of the Ravenland from Free League's Forbidden Lands
CALENDARIA.Calendar.ForbiddenLands.Name: Forbidden Lands
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Galifar.Description: The calendar of Khorvaire from the Eberron campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Galifar.Name: Galifar
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Golarion.Description: The Absalom Reckoning calendar used in the Pathfinder campaign setting of Golarion
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Golarion.Name: Absalom Reckoning
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Gregorian.Descriptio: The standard Gregorian calendar used in the modern world
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Gregorian.Name: Gregorian
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Greyhawk.Description: The Calendar of Oerth, used in the World of Greyhawk campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Greyhawk.Name: Greyhawk
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Greyhawk364.Descript: The 364-day Calendar of Oerth from Dragon #68, with 7-day festival weeks and accurate lunar cycles
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Greyhawk364.Name: Greyhawk (Dragon #68)
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Harptos.Description: The Calendar of Harptos, used in the Forgotten Realms campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Harptos.Name: Harptos
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Khorvaire.Descriptio: The Calendar of Khorvaire, used in the Eberron campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Khorvaire.Name: Khorvaire
CALENDARIA.Calendar.KrynnElven.Descripti: The elven calendar of Krynn, used by the Qualinesti and Silvanesti
CALENDARIA.Calendar.KrynnElven.Name: Krynn (Elven)
CALENDARIA.Calendar.KrynnSolamnia.Descri: The Solamnic calendar of Krynn, used by humans of Ansalon
CALENDARIA.Calendar.KrynnSolamnia.Name: Krynn (Solamnic)
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Renescara.Descriptio: The calendar of Renescara - 13 perfect months of 28 days each, plus the Day of Threshold
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Renescara.Name: Renescarran
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Thyatian.Description: The calendar of the Thyatian Empire from the Mystara campaign setting
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Thyatian.Name: Thyatian
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Traveller.Descriptio: The Imperial Calendar used throughout the Third Imperium. 365 days with no months, dates expressed as day-year (e.g., 145-1105).
CALENDARIA.Calendar.Traveller.Name: Traveller Imperial
CALENDARIA.CalendarApp.NoCalendarConfigu: No calendar configured. Select a calendar in the settings.
CALENDARIA.ChatCommand.NoCycles: No cycles configured for this calendar.
CALENDARIA.ChatCommand.NoMoons: No moons configured for this calendar.
CALENDARIA.ChatCommand.NoPermission: You do not have permission to use this command.
CALENDARIA.ChatCommander.NoCycles: No cycles configured for this calendar.
CALENDARIA.Common.ForcedDisplayWarning: This window cannot be closed because the GM has enabled force display.
CALENDARIA.Common.IconHint: Visit fontawesome.com/icons to browse available icons.
CALENDARIA.Common.Name: Name
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"? This cannot be undone.
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmLoadTemplate: Load "{name}" as a starting point? This will replace your current settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmReset: Reset the form to a blank calendar? This will clear all current settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.ConfirmResetToDefault: Reset this calendar to its original default state? Your customizations will be removed.
CALENDARIA.Editor.DateFormatVariables.De: Standard tokens: YYYY, YY, MMMM, MMM, MM, M, DD, D, dddd, ddd, HH, H, hh, h, mm, A, a. Custom tokens in brackets: [moon], [era], [season], [ch], [chAbbr]
CALENDARIA.Editor.DefaultCopied: Created editable copy of {name}. Save to create your custom version.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Duplicated: Created copy of {name}. Save to keep it.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Error.MinOneMonth: Calendar must have at least one month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Error.MinOneWeekday: Calendar must have at least one weekday.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.AllowNegativeYear: Allow navigation to years before year 1.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CanonicalHours: Named time-of-day periods (e.g., Midday, Afternoon, Evening).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CycleFormat: Shown on the cycle indicator in calendar applications. Use [1], [2], etc. for each cycle's current stage name.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.CycleLength: How many days for the moon to complete one full cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Cycles: Named repeating patterns like zodiac signs or elemental weeks.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaylightEnabled: When enabled, sunrise and sunset times vary throughout the year based on the shortest and longest day configured below. When disabled, daylight is a static 50/50 split.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaylightZoneOverr: Climate zones with a latitude or manual daylight setting will override these global values.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaysPerYear: Total days in a non-leap year. Should match the sum of all month days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.DaysPerYearComput: Calculated from the sum of days in all months.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Festivals: Special days that have unique names. These appear on the calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.FirstWeekday: Which weekday falls on the first day of year 0.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.HoursPerDay: Number of hours in each day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapDays: Days in this month during leap years (leave empty if same).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapGregorian: Uses Gregorian rules: divisible by 400, or by 4 but not 100. (e.g., 2000 and 2004 are leap years, 1900 is not)
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapInterval: How many years between leap years (e.g., 4 for every 4 years).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapPattern: Comma-separated intervals. Use ! prefix to exclude. Example: "400,!100,4" = Gregorian rules.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LeapStart: The first year that is a leap year (offset for calculations).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.LongestDay: Hours of daylight on the longest day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Months: Define the months of your calendar. Order matters - drag to reorder.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Moons: Configure moons and their cycles. Each moon has a reference date when it was new.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Name: This name will appear in the calendar selector.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.NamedWeeks: Named repeating week periods (e.g., 'Week of the Harvest', 'Holy Week').
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.NamedYears: Assign display names to specific years. Use [yearName|YYYY] in format strings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.ReferenceDate: A known date and phase used to anchor moon cycle calculations.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.ResetWeekdays: Start each year on the first weekday, resetting the continuous weekday cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SeasonalType: Maps custom seasons to canonical weather types for integrations.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SeasonOffset: Day of year when the first season begins (0 = first day of year).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Seasons: Define seasons by day ranges. Optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SeasonsFields: Each row: name, abbreviation, icon (FontAwesome class), color, and date range (start month/day to end month/day).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SeasonsFieldsPeri: Each row: name, abbreviation, icon (FontAwesome class), color, and duration in days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SeasonType: Dated seasons have specific start/end dates. Periodic seasons repeat based on duration.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.ShortestDay: Hours of daylight on the shortest day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.SummerSolstice: Date when daylight is longest (summer solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.System: The game world or setting this calendar is from.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Template: Load an existing calendar as a starting point for customization.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.TimeStructure: Configure how time is measured in your world.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.Weekdays: Define the days of the week. The week repeats in this order.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WeeksPerMonth: For month-based counting, how many weeks fit in each month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WeeksRepeat: When enabled, named weeks repeat beyond the last defined week number. When disabled, only the explicitly numbered weeks are named.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WeeksType: How named weeks progress. Per Year counts weeks continuously across the entire year. Per Month resets the week count at the start of each month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.WinterSolstice: Date when daylight is shortest (winter solstice).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.YearZero: The year that displays as year 0 when world time starts.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Hint.YearZeroWeekday: Which weekday falls on the first day of year zero.
CALENDARIA.Editor.LoadCalendarPrompt: What would you like to do with "{name}"?
CALENDARIA.Editor.Month.CustomWeekdaysHi: Override the global weekday names for this specific month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Month.EnableCustomWeek: Use custom weekday names for this month
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.BulletFo: Month format tokens (M, MM, MMM, MMMM) return empty strings. Use day-of-year format (DDD) instead.
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.BulletNa: MiniCal displays one week at a time instead of a month grid.
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.BulletSe: Seasons and festivals use day-of-year ranges instead of month references.
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.Descript: This calendar has no months defined and will operate in monthless mode. Days are numbered 1 through the total days per year.
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.Hint: Add a month below if you want standard month-based navigation. The Traveller Imperial Calendar is an example of a monthless calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.MonthlessMode.Title: Monthless Calendar Mode
CALENDARIA.Editor.MoveDown.DisabledTitle: Already at the bottom of the list
CALENDARIA.Editor.MoveDown.Label: Move Down
CALENDARIA.Editor.MoveUp.DisabledTitle: Already at the top of the list
CALENDARIA.Editor.MoveUp.Label: Move Up
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoCanonicalHours: No canonical hours defined. Canonical hours are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoCycles: No cycles defined. Cycles are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoEras: No eras defined. Eras are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoFestivals: No festivals defined. Festivals are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoMoons: No moons defined. Moons are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoNamedWeeks: No named weeks defined. Named weeks are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoNamedYears: No named years defined. Named years are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoSeasons: No seasons defined. Seasons are optional.
CALENDARIA.Editor.NoStages: No stages defined. Each cycle requires at least one stage.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Placeholder.Name: Enter calendar name
CALENDARIA.Editor.Season.Climate.Tempera: Base temperature range for this season. Leave empty to use zone defaults.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Season.Climate.Title: Climate Settings: {name}
CALENDARIA.Editor.Season.Climate.Weather: Set probability for each weather type. Leave empty for weather not typical in this season.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.AmPmNot: Custom labels for morning and afternoon time periods.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Calenda: The name and description of this calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Canonic: Named divisions of the day used for liturgical or narrative time.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Cycles: Repeating sequences of named stages, such as zodiac signs or regnal periods.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.CycleSt: The individual named stages within this cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.DateFor: Customize how dates and times are displayed throughout the interface.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Dayligh: Configure the shortest and longest days of the year for sunrise/sunset calculations.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Eras: Named historical periods with start and end years.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Festiva: Special days or holidays that appear on the calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.LeapYea: Configure how leap years add extra days to the calendar.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Months: The months that make up a calendar year.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Moons: Celestial bodies with configurable phases and cycles.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Seasons: Seasonal periods that affect weather and daylight.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.TimeStr: The fundamental time units: hours, minutes, seconds, and combat rounds.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.Weekday: The days that make up a week.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SectionTooltip.YearSet: Core year configuration including the starting year and weekday alignment.
CALENDARIA.Editor.SetAsActiveHint: Makes this the active calendar and reloads the world to apply the change.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Title: Create New Calendar
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddEra: Insert a new era below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddFestival: Insert a new festival below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddMonth: Insert a new month below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddSeason: Insert a new season below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddStage: Add a new stage to this cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.AddWeekday: Insert a new weekday below this one.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CountsForWeekd: This day exists 'outside' the week cycle and doesn't advance the weekday (e.g., Midwinter is neither Monday nor Tuesday).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleBasedOn: Calendar Year: advances each year. Era Year: advances each year, resets at era boundaries. Day of Month: resets each month. Day of Year: resets each year. Absolute Day: total days since epoch, never resets.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleDayAdjust: Fine-tune phase alignment by shifting the cycle by this many days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleFormat: Shown on the cycle indicator in calendar applications. Use [1], [2], etc. for each cycle's current stage name.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleLength: Length of the moon's cycle in days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CycleName: Name of this cycle (e.g., Zodiac, Elemental Week).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.CyclePeriod: How many units before advancing to the next stage. Use 1 for one stage per unit.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.DuplicateWeekN: Duplicate week number. Each named week must have a unique number.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.EditSeasonClim: Configure weather and temperature for this season.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.EraEndYear: Year when this era ends. Leave empty if ongoing.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FadingName: Sub-phase name for the end of this phase (e.g., 'Fading New Moon'). Leave blank to auto-generate.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalDay: Day of the month when this festival begins.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalDurati: Number of days this festival lasts.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalIcon: Edit icon and color for this festival.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalLeapDu: Duration on leap years (blank = same as normal).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.FestivalName: Name of the festival or special day.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.LeapYearOnly: This festival only appears in leap years.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., March → Mar) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthDays: How many days in this month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthLeap: Total days in this month during leap years. Leave empty if same.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MonthType: Standard: A normal month. Intercalary: Days outside the regular calendar structure (e.g., holidays between months).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MoonColor: Tint color for this moon's icon display.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.MoonPhases: Drag the slider handles or edit Start/End values to adjust phase ranges.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseEnd: Cycle position where this phase ends (0-100%).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseIcon: Click to select a custom icon.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.PhaseStart: Cycle position where this phase starts (0-100%).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.ReferencePhase: The phase the moon was in on the reference date.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RemoveStage: Remove this stage from the cycle.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RestDay: Mark as a rest day (e.g., weekend).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.RisingName: Sub-phase name for the start of this phase (e.g., 'Rising New Moon'). Leave blank to auto-generate.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., Winter → Win) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonColor: Color for the season icon (hex color).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonDuration: Duration of this season in days.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonEnd: Month and day when this season ends.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonEndDay: Day of the month when this season ends. Leave empty for end of month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonIcon: Font Awesome icon class (e.g., fas fa-snowflake).
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonStart: Month and day when this season starts.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.SeasonStartDay: Day of the month when this season starts. Leave empty for start of month.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.StartingWeekda: Force this month to always start on a specific weekday. 'Auto' uses normal weekday progression.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.WeekdayAbbr: Abbreviation (e.g., Monday → Mon) or alternative title.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.WeekName: Name of this week (e.g., 'Stag Week', 'Dragon Week').
CALENDARIA.Editor.Tooltip.WeekNumber: The week number this name applies to.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Warning.DaysMismatch: Months total {calculated} days, but days per year is set differently.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Warning.TimeSettings: Changing the below values may have unintended consequences within your system, use caution.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.AutoGenerateHi: Automatically generate weather when the day changes.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.NoSeasons: Define seasons in the Seasons tab to configure seasonal climate.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.SeasonClimateH: Define base weather patterns for each season. These act as defaults that zones can override.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Tooltip.Enable: Enable or disable this weather type
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Tooltip.Name: Weather type name
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Tooltip.Rename: Custom display name (leave empty for default)
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.Brightnes: Adjust sunlight intensity for this climate. Lower = dimmer (e.g., arctic twilight), higher = brighter.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.DaylightH: Set a latitude for astronomical daylight, or enable Override Solstice to manually set daylight hours. Leave all blank to use global settings.
Hours of daylight. Leave blank to use global daylight settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.DeleteCon: Are you sure you want to delete the '{name}' climate zone?
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.Environme: Override scene ambient lighting color. Leave blank to use scene defaults.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.LatitudeH: Degrees (-90 to 90). Positive = north, negative = south. Controls sunrise/sunset via the astronomical hour-angle formula.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.Name: Zone Name
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.OverrideS: Manually set shortest and longest day hours instead of calculating from latitude.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.Zone.Temperatu: Values are in {unit}, as configured in module settings.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.ZoneClimateHin: Define climate zones with per-zone temperature and weather overrides. Zones override the seasonal base layer.
CALENDARIA.Editor.Weather.ZonePresetsHin: Configure weather probabilities for this zone. These override season defaults.
CALENDARIA.Error.GMOnly.JumpToDate: Only GMs can jump to date

CALENDARIA.Format.EscapeHint: Use brackets to include literal text that won't be parsed as tokens.

CALENDARIA.Format.StopwatchGametimeHint: Format for game-time mode. Supports HH, mm, ss.
CALENDARIA.Format.StopwatchRealtimeHint: Format for real-time mode. Supports HH, mm, ss, SSS (milliseconds).
CALENDARIA.Format.Token.moonIcon: Moon phase icon (use [moonIcon=0] or [moonIcon='Name'] for specific moon)

CALENDARIA.HUD.Settings.ResetPositionHin: Reset the HUD to its default position.
CALENDARIA.HUD.Settings.StickyPositionHi: Keep HUD position locked when dragging.
CALENDARIA.HUD.Settings.StickyTrayHint: Keep time controls tray always visible.

CALENDARIA.Permissions.AddNotesHint: Allow users to create calendar notes and events.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.ChangeActiveCalen: Allow users to switch which calendar is active for the world.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.ChangeDateTimeHin: Allow users to adjust the current date and time via time controls.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.ChangeWeatherHint: Allow users to set or generate weather conditions.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.DeleteNotesHint: Allow users to delete calendar notes in bulk.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.EditCalendarsHint: Allow users to open the calendar editor and modify calendar definitions.
CALENDARIA.Permissions.EditNotesHint: Allow users to edit calendar notes owned by other players. Does not apply to GM-only notes.

CALENDARIA.Scene.BrightnessMultiplier.Hi: Adjust how bright this scene gets during daytime. Lower values = dimmer sunlight (e.g., arctic tundra), higher values = brighter (e.g., desert).
CALENDARIA.Scene.ClimateZoneOverride.Hin: Override the calendar's active climate zone for this scene. Affects weather generation, darkness adjustments, and ambient lighting.
CALENDARIA.Scene.ClimateZoneOverride.NoZ: Your calendar does not have any climate zones.
CALENDARIA.Scene.DarknessSync.Hint: Allow Calendaria to override the global setting to sync this scene's darkness level with the position of the sun.

CALENDARIA.Scene.HudHideForPlayers.Hint: Automatically hide the Calendaria HUD for players when this scene becomes active.
CALENDARIA.Scene.HudHideForPlayers.Name: Hide HUD for Players
CALENDARIA.SetDate.NoTimepoints: No saved timepoints. Save the current time to create one.
CALENDARIA.SetDate.SkipTriggersHint: Prevents firing day change, sunrise/sunset, and other event hooks when jumping
CALENDARIA.SetDate.Title: Set Date & Time
CALENDARIA.Settings.ActiveCalendar.Disab: You don't have permission to change the calendar

CALENDARIA.Settings.AdvanceTimeOnRest.Hi: Automatically advance world time when characters take short or long rests.
Allow the HUD to be dragged over the sidebar area. Useful if you've relocated the sidebar with another module.

CALENDARIA.Settings.AmbienceSync.Name: Sync Scene Ambience with Weather
CALENDARIA.Settings.AutoFade.Hint: Fade when idle. Returns to full visibility on hover.
CALENDARIA.Settings.AutoFade.Name: Auto-Fade When Idle

CALENDARIA.Settings.BigCalEraDisplayMode: How to display era names on the BigCal.
CALENDARIA.Settings.BigCalHeaderShowSele: When a date is selected, show that date in the header instead of the viewed month/year.
CALENDARIA.Settings.BigCalSeasonDisplayM: How to display season information on the BigCal.
CALENDARIA.Settings.BigCalShowCycles.Hin: Show or hide cycle indicators on the BigCal.
CALENDARIA.Settings.BigCalShowEra.Hint: Show or hide the era indicator on the BigCal.

CALENDARIA.Settings.DarknessSync.Hint: Automatically sync scene darkness levels with the position of the sun based on the current time. This is the default for new scenes.

CALENDARIA.Settings.DarknessSyncAllScene: Sync darkness across all scenes, not just the active one.
Allow weather conditions to affect scene darkness (e.g., overcast skies making scenes dimmer). Disable to prevent weather from changing lighting.
CALENDARIA.Settings.DefaultBrightnessMul: Default brightness for all scenes. Lower = dimmer sunlight (e.g., 0.7 for polar regions), higher = brighter. Scenes can override this individually.

Create a custom weather condition for use in climate configurations.
Darkness penalty (-0.5 to 0.5). Positive = darker (overcast), negative = brighter (magical glow).
Override scene ambient lighting when this weather is active. Leave blank for no effect.

CALENDARIA.SettingsPanel.WeatherTab.Play: Weather configuration is managed by the GM. Contact your GM to request changes.
CALENDARIA.SettingsPanel.Welcome.Closing: Calendaria is a passion project, and I'm always working to make it better. If something isn't working the way you'd expect, or you have an idea that would make your life easier, drop by the Discord or open an issue on GitHub. Your feedback shapes what comes next, and I genuinely appreciate everyone who takes the time to share it.
CALENDARIA.SettingsPanel.Welcome.Descrip: To get started, select your calendar system below and explore the tabs on the left. The HUD, MiniCal, and TimeKeeper tabs let you configure the on-screen displays your players will see. If you want time to pass automatically, check out the Time tab. For dynamic lighting that follows the sun, head to Canvas.
CALENDARIA.SettingsPanel.Welcome.Getting: Need a custom calendar? Open the Calendar Editor to build your own from scratch, or use the Importer to bring in calendars from other modules. The wiki has detailed guides for every feature, and the Discord is always open if you get stuck.
CALENDARIA.SettingsPanel.Welcome.Greetin: Thanks for using Calendaria! I built this module because I wanted time to feel alive in my games—seasons that shift, moons that wax and wane, and a world that moves forward even when the players aren't watching.
CALENDARIA.Sheet.BareBonesMessage: Calendar journal sheet - bare bones implementation.
